I saw this once too.  No bad behavior, and next startup worked fine.  I wonder if it is due to the fact that a -clean was not specified.  Let me know if you see any other weirdness.

Note to self: try to replicate by having no Mylar installed into an Eclipse that previously had it so that the Task List is closed, then install 2.0M1.
From what I can tell -clean fixes this, but I'm confused as to why it can happen on an update manager based restart.  If anyone sees this again please reopen.
